intro: Manisuris striata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed manisuris, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and finely divided, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is often found in moist, temperate regions and thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
